html: In February, Congress authorized $415 million for humanitarian aid at the border. I can’t say from what I have seen today that it looks like the money is being spent on humanitarian needs. Maybe @SecNielsen can tell us where that money is and what it’s being spent on.
text: In February, Congress authorized $415 million for humanitarian aid at the border. I can’t say from what I have seen today that it looks like the money is being spent on humanitarian needs. Maybe @SecNielsen can tell us where that money is and what it’s being spent on.

html: We’re at Station #1 where we met with families who were transported from the PDN Bridge. We’re told conditions here are better but families are held in tents, women & children are wearing dirty clothes & sleeping on the ground with Mylar blankets, including a four month old baby.pic.twitter.com/3GxCl7LGJY
text: We’re at Station #1 where we met with families who were transported from the PDN Bridge. We’re told conditions here are better but families are held in tents, women & children are wearing dirty clothes & sleeping on the ground with Mylar blankets, including a four month old baby.pic.twitter.com/3GxCl7LGJY

html: We just left the Paso Del Norte Bridge, under which migrant families are still being held for several hours. We saw officers ask migrants to turn over their belongings while others slept on the ground with Mylar sheets. The conditions were terrible. #DemsAtTheBorder @HomelandDemspic.twitter.com/igUmjAaGEq
text: We just left the Paso Del Norte Bridge, under which migrant families are still being held for several hours. html: Today, on #EqualPayDay, we recognize that three months into the year, women earn what men made in the previous year. This is unacceptable. After passing #PaycheckFairness Act in the House last week, I urge my colleagues in the Senate to do the same!pic.twitter.com/fP00HubrMu

html: What’s the GOP plan for healthcare in America? It’s called REPEAL and DISPLACE. Republicans want to strip away protections from more than 100 million Americans with pre-existing conditions (with no alternative). They. Will. Not. Succeed.
text:
What’s the GOP plan for healthcare in America?

It’s called REPEAL and DISPLACE.

Republicans want to strip away protections from more than 100 million Americans with pre-existing conditions (with no alternative).

They. Will. Not. Succeed.

text:
For years, transgender service members have been able to serve openly and honorably. This morning,  I voted to reject President Trump’s discriminatory ban on transgender Americans serving in our military. 

Trans people #WontBeErased.pic.twitter.com/5QtPlx1BHP

text:
Heart disease is the leading cause of death for women in the US, especially women of color. That’s why last week, I joined my colleagues in wearing red to support & raise awareness for women’s heart health.

This #HeartMonth, I encourage you to join the cause & #GoRedForWomen.pic.twitter.com/BbfWFyNInL

html: We MUST fight lies with truth. 1. Most deadly drugs crossing border DO go through legal ports of entry. 2. Undoc/doc immigrants are convicted of crime at a LOWER RATE than general population. 3. Undocumented border crossings are at *near historic* lows. There IS no emergency.
text:
We MUST fight lies with truth.

1. Most deadly drugs crossing border DO go through legal ports of entry.

2. Undoc/doc immigrants are convicted of crime at a LOWER RATE than general population.

3. Undocumented border crossings are at *near historic* lows.

There IS no emergency.

html: Today, we remember and honor civil rights icon Rosa Parks, who was born on this day 106 years ago. Her quiet act of defiance sparked a movement that spurred change. May her fearlessness and courage continue to motivate us to fight and seek justice. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/Gu17EIs8pV
text:
Today, we remember and honor civil rights icon Rosa Parks, who was born on this day 106 years ago.

Her quiet act of defiance sparked a movement that spurred change. May her fearlessness and courage continue to motivate us to fight and seek justice. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/Gu17EIs8pV

html: On this day in 1870, the Fifteen Amendment was ratified - allowing people of color the right to vote. Today, we celebrate those who have fought and died for our right to vote. We must continue to fight as we work to ensure voting rights and election integrity in #HR1.pic.twitter.com/hizxSoye3m
text:
On this day in 1870, the Fifteen Amendment was ratified - allowing people of color the right to vote.

Today, we celebrate those who have fought and died for our right to vote. We must continue to fight as we work to ensure voting rights and election integrity in #HR1.pic.twitter.com/hizxSoye3m

html: We must call out racism when we see and hear it. The photo on Governor Northam’s medical school yearbook page is disturbing and racist. I join my colleagues in the @OfficialCBC and @HispanicCaucus in calling for Governor Ralph Northam’s resignation.

html: Deeply saddened by the passing of Dr. Michelle King, the first black woman to serve as Superintendent of Schools at @LASchools. As a lifelong educator, she lived her life in service of others. May her legacy live on and may she rest in peace.

html: Social Security provides the foundation of economic stability for nearly all Americans, but especially for people of color. Without it, 46% of Hispanic seniors & 52% of African-American seniors would live in poverty. That’s why I’m proud to co-sponsor #Secure2100.pic.twitter.com/0cjjxdT8HQ

html: 10 years ago today, the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act was signed into law. Although we’ve made great strides, the gender wage gap still persists. Pay discrimination continues to harm women and families. We must keep up the fight and use our strong voice to achieve #EqualPay.pic.twitter.com/rRff2ziN45
text:
10 years ago today, the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act was signed into law. Although we’ve made great strides, the gender wage gap still persists. Pay discrimination continues to harm women and families. 

We must keep up the fight and use our strong voice to achieve #EqualPay.pic.twitter.com/rRff2ziN45

html: After 35 days of suffering & two missed paychecks for hundreds of thousands of federal workers, the president has finally decided to re-open the government he proudly shutdown. Now, let’s keep it open, pay our civil servants & have honest negotiations on border security. #NoWall

html: #RoeVWade protects women’s fundamental rights – to privacy, to choose, to control their own bodies. Yet 46 years later, these rights are still being attacked. On #Roe46, I vow to continue to #FightForRoe and defend women’s freedoms to make their own health care decisions.
text:
#RoeVWade protects women’s fundamental rights – to privacy, to choose, to control their own bodies. Yet 46 years later, these rights are still being attacked. 

On #Roe46, I vow to continue to #FightForRoe and defend women’s freedoms to make their own health care decisions.

html: It’s day 22 of the #TrumpShutdown & hard-working Americans are struggling to make ends meet - many are unable to put food on the table & without housing. It’s time for the President to put an end to this - the livelihood of families are not a bargaining chip to be toyed with.
text:
It’s day 22 of the #TrumpShutdown & hard-working Americans are struggling to make ends meet - many are unable to put food on the table & without housing.

It’s time for the President to put an end to this - the livelihood of families are not a bargaining chip to be toyed with.

html: On Day One of the #116thCongress, my colleagues and I voted on a spending package that would reopen the government. This week, we voted on separate funding bills that would reopen portions of the government. Yet, Republican Senators refuse to take them up & end the shutdown.https://twitter.com/AP/status/1083957198630342657 …
text:
On Day One of the #116thCongress, my colleagues and I voted on a spending package that would reopen the government. This week, we voted on separate funding bills that would reopen portions of the government. 

Yet, Republican Senators refuse to take them up & end the shutdown.https://twitter.com/AP/status/1083957198630342657 …

text:
I’m gonna be real honest with you all:  we have been sitting at this port of entry for 14 hours now - trying to help these asylum seekers present for asylum.  They have fenced us in, they’ve tried to intimidate us. This is what an asylum ban looks like. 

But we need your help.

html: Latinos make up 46% of Metro’s rail ridership and 66% of Metro’s bus ridership. Latinos are underrepresented in the decision-making of our transit infrastructure. I, with Latino members of #LACounty’s congressional delegation, met with Metro today to discuss how to change this.pic.twitter.com/0l3mo5bLED
text: Latinos make up 46% of Metro’s rail ridership and 66% of Metro’s bus ridership. Latinos are underrepresented in the decision-making of our transit infrastructure. .@RepRichmond: "The CBC believes that, if confirmed, Judge Kavanaugh’s views on voting rights, policing, and executive power would threaten African Americans’ years-long struggle for equality and justice." 

To #StopKavanaugh, call your senators at (202) 224-3121. #WhatsAtStakepic.twitter.com/QpjnkwbhFq

html: For over 6 years, #DACA has helped thousands go to college & get jobs. Instead of enshrining this opportunity to the over 1 million that are eligible, the administration decided one year ago today that it would end the program & put thousands at risk. Congress must #ProtectDACA.
